item.title: [Understand the shortest] Python basics for data analysis
item.description: #Introduction For those who want to analyze data using Python … or those who have decided to use Python for seminars and research but have never done programming … Once you know this, the basics are okay for now (Maybe). I think it can be used as a review of knowledge. First, we will cover the basics of general-purpose Python syntax to a minimum, and then describe the basic tools and techniques used for data analysis.

item.title: [Python] I tried to solve 100 questions of past questions that should be solved by beginners [Part 5/22]

item.title: Every day in Python AtCoder #14
item.description: ### Introduction Last time Day 14 #14 Today is B. Thoughts ABC081-B ABC081-B divides by 2 when $A_i$ is even. When it is an odd number, I quit immediately. n = int(input()) a = list(map(int,input().split())) counter = [] for i in range(n): count = 0 if a[i] %2 == 0: while a[i] %2 == 0: a[i] //= 2 count += 1 counter.append(count) else: print(0) quit() print(min(counter)) ABC087-B ABC087-B has a triple loop with thought stop.

item.title: Let's take a free Python introductory course for machine learning online until April 27th
item.description: Yes~mo :clap: Today, I’m going to take “Python introductory course for machine learning **” online. This is an online course for machine learning super beginners, developed by Skill-Up AI Co., Ltd. in cooperation with the Japan Deep Learning Association. If it is true, it costs about 50,000 yen, but for people who are discerning with the example corona 2020/4/30By 2020/4/27 If you apply, 2020/ You can read the teaching materials until 4/30!

item.title: Solve ABC158A~C with Python
item.description: ### Introduction I forgot that I couldn’t participate, so I will solve it. I solved it by midnight tension + I am writing at midnight, so the sentence may have collapsed. A problem Problem Thoughts Just count A and B in S. Set to No only when all are A and B. .. I counted it with str.count and put it in if. s = str(input()) station_a = s.count('A') station_b = s.

item.title: I thought about how to learn programming for free.
item.description: # Background I thought about a low-cost way to learn programming from an empty situation. (Mac) Is the continuation of. This time, I summarized how to take a smartphone and learn the program for free for those who are new to buying a PC. OPAC-Library search system Perhaps it is OPAC that university graduates know but middle and high school graduates do not. If you are a university, you will be asked at the first orientation of your first year to search for books, magazines, papers, etc.

item.title: Website change monitoring using python
item.description: I made it because I wanted to monitor changes in a certain site. Currently I am monitoring my self-introduction sentence, but I can use it on other sites by changing the url and class_name. The page data is acquired every 20 seconds, and it is displayed whether the data is different from the previous acquisition. import requests import time from bs4 import BeautifulSoup url = "https://qiita.com/sssssssiiiiinnn" class_name ='div.newUserPageProfile_info_body.newUserPageProfile_description' file = "elems_text.

item.title: Process huge excel files with Python to improve productivity
item.description: >This article was published in November 2019 by [Benedikt Droste](https://towardsdatascience.com/@droste.benedikt),"[BoostyourefficiencyandprocessExcel-fileswithPython](https://towardsdatascience.com/boost-your-efficiency-and-process-excel-files-with-python-cae650c85d6c)”. This article is published with the permission of the original author. When you’re working with data, you inevitably come into contact with Excel. Even if you don’t use it for yourself, it will be needed by clients and colleagues. Excel excels in spreadsheets with small datasets. But I always lamented when I saw an Excel sheet with tens of thousands of rows and hundreds of columns.

item.title: Steps to develop Django with VSCode
item.description: 2020/03/13 Modified slightly to match VSCode Version 1.43.0 Introduction A beginner yearned for the word debug, and learned that VS Code can actually do it, and tried setting it. The memorandum. I think that the advantage is that once you set it, you can enter the virtual environment and run the server just by pressing the Debug button. You can save yourself the trouble of going back and forth between the browser and Terminal and VS Code and entering source myenv/bin/activate or python manage.

item.title: Hit the Spotify API with Django.
item.description: #Introduction This article is from Django Advent Calendar 2019. The target audience is for those who are new to Django. The previous article was about @yuu-eguci’s 500 error. https://qiita.com/yuu-eguci/items/a1e4b0a2f238d5ccc985 This article is about trying to execute Spotify API with Django. Advance preparation I need to create a user account for Spotify, but the following article by Class Method is very helpful. https://dev.classmethod.jp/etc/about-using-of-spotify-api/ If you want to execute the sample code of the article, please download the chart data in CSV format from the following.

item.title: Kaggle's initial equipment-a cell that collects frequently used codes-
item.description: #Introduction When working on Kaggle1, which is a competition platform for data science, Python2 written in Notebook3(orJupyterNotebook[^JupyterNotebook]orGoogleColaboratory[^GoogleColaboratory])istheexecutionenvironment.]]Ithinkthereisa"highlyusedcode”.Inordertoreuseit,Iwillintroduceitinonecellasaformatthatiseasytocopyandpasteanyway.Wehopethatbyreusingthecontentsofthiscell,wecanimprovetheefficiencyofdataanalysisinKaggle.(Thisis“Kaggle’sinitialequipment”!) *This article is based on the Notebook published by Kaggler (Kaggle participant) predecessors and the book [Technology of data analysis that wins at Kaggle]. However, it is the individual subjectivity as of December 2019. Therefore, please see for your reference. #Conclusion What is Kaggle’s initial equipment? This cell! #Display Notebook from IPython.core.interactiveshell import InteractiveShell InteractiveShell.

item.title: [First data science ⑤] I tried to help my friend's first property search by data analysis
item.description: Nice to meet you. My name is S.I, a third year college student in the Department of Information Engineering. My experience with Python is a little dealt with in a college experiment. The data science division of Bracket Co., Ltd., where I am an intern, has the task of creating a crawler during the trial period to collect, process, visualize data, and briefly describe what I learned. Task Theme My university friend will live alone.

item.title: ``First time learning'' that even university students with no knowledge can do-AWS SageMaker
item.description: # My background Amazon? Ah, you know, you know, a mail order app. Not long ago, knowledge about Amazon was that much. Of course, I didn’t even know AWS. I’m ashamed as an information undergraduate student. However, as a 3rd year university student, I was introduced to the lab and learned about AWS. In addition, I am addicted to the topic “Atsuhiko Nakata’s YouTube University”, which is a hot topic in this street.
